body.p: The Board observed that the term ‘estimate’ in IFRS Standards sometimes refers not only to accounting estimates, but also to other estimates. For example, it sometimes refers to inputs used in developing accounting estimates. As discussed in paragraph BC47(b), the Board specified that the effects on an accounting estimate of a change in an input are changes in accounting estimates. Therefore, the Board concluded it was unnecessary to also amend references to the term ‘estimate’ when that term refers to an input used in developing accounting estimates.
